DataElement.preferredName: Follow-Up Outcome Expectations Questionnaire Feelings About Ability to Deal with Treatment and Recovery Score 4 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of their feelings about their ability to deal with treatment and recovery using a 4-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Follow-Up Outcome Expectations Questionnaire Feelings About Ability to Deal with Treatment and Recovery Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A set of questions and responses designed to evaluate an individual's self-reported expectations with the outcome of treatment._A question about an individual's feelings regarding their ability to deal with treatment and recovery._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Expected Ability Level Score 4 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A four point ordered reference set for the subjective scoring of a person's expected ability level that ranges from 1: Better than I expected to 4: I didn't know what to expect.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I didn't know what to expect.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I didn't know what to expect.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual didn't know what to expect.

Concepts.longName: Did Not Know What to Expect
Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual does or didn't know what to expect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating something was worse than expected.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating something was worse than expected.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It was about what I expected.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It was about what I expected.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that something was as expected.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that something was as expected.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating something was better than expected.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating something was better than expected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
